    <h3><a name="introduction">1 Introduction</a></h3>
    <p>
      This form is used to view, insert, or edit the values of a compatibility
      between two garments.
    </p>
    <h3><a name="fields">2 How to compile the fields</a></h3>
    <p>
      <h5>2.1 Garment #1</h5>
      This field represent the first garment. It is not editable.
      <h5>2.2 Garment #2</h5>
      Press this button to open a list and choose the second garment.
      <h5>2.3 Compatibility level</h5>
      Select the compatibility level between the two garments. The meaning of
      compatibility levels is explained below.
    </p>
    <h3><a name="levels">3 Compatibility levels</a></h3>
    <p>
      <h5>Don't fit</h5>
      The garments really can't be put together.
      <h5>Better not</h5>
      It's better not to mix the two garments together.
      <h5>OK</h5>
      There's no problem in mixing the garments.
      <h5>Very good</h5>
      The garments really fit well.
    </p>
    <h3><a name="options_menu">4 Options menu</a></h3>
    <p>
      These are the options you can select:
      <h5>2.1 Edit compatibility</h5>
      This option is enabled only if you are in view mode and the fields are
      not editable. It allows you to edit the parameters of the compatibility.
      <h5>2.2 Delete compatibility</h5>
      Choose this option to delete the compatibility.
    </p>
